flounder.sounds

Class SoundSource

  • java.lang.Object
    • flounder.sounds.SoundSource

  • public class SoundSource
extends java.lang.Object
    Sound sources are what play the sounds in OpenAL. This class represents one source, capable of playing one sound at a time. This object also determines how the sound is played (volume, position, etc).

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      protected SoundSource()
      Creates a new sound source and gives it some default settings.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected void delete()
      Deletes the source.
      protected int getFinishedBuffersCount() 
      protected float getVolume() 
      protected boolean isPlaying() 
      protected void loop(boolean loop) 
      protected void pause()
      Pauses the sound source.
      protected AudioController playSound(Sound sound)
      Plays a sound and returns an AudioController which allows the settings of the source to be changed while the sound is playing.
      protected void queue(int buffer)
      Queues up a buffer to be played by this source as soon as it has finished playing the current buffer (for use when streaming).
      protected void setInactive()
      Indicates that the source has finished playing the current sound.
      protected void setPosition(Vector3f position) 
      protected void setRange(float radius) 
      protected void setRanges(float primaryRadius, float secondaryRadius)
      Sets the inner and outer ranges for the source.
      protected void setUndiminishing()
      Indicates that the sound has no range, and will always be played at full volume regardless of where the listener and source are.
      protected void setVolume(float newVolume)
      Sets the volume of the source.
      protected void stop()
      Stops the source playing the current sound.
      protected void unpause()
      Unpauses the currently paused sound source.
      protected void unqueue()
      Removes the top buffer that has already been played from the queue (for use when streaming).

    • Constructor Detail

      • SoundSource

        protected SoundSource()
        Creates a new sound source and gives it some default settings.

    • Method Detail

      • setRange

        protected void setRange(float radius)
        Parameters:
        radius - - the range of the sound. Outside this range the sound can't be heard. Between the position of the source and the outer radius the volume of the sound decreases linearly.

      • setUndiminishing

        protected void setUndiminishing()
        Indicates that the sound has no range, and will always be played at full volume regardless of where the listener and source are.

      • setRanges

        protected void setRanges(float primaryRadius,
                         float secondaryRadius)
        Sets the inner and outer ranges for the source. Inside the inner range sounds are heard at full volume. Between the inner and outer radiuses the volume of sounds decreases linearly.
        Parameters:
        primaryRadius - The inner range.
        secondaryRadius - The outer range.

      • getVolume

        protected float getVolume()
        Returns:
        The source's volume.

      • setVolume

        protected void setVolume(float newVolume)
        Sets the volume of the source. Any sounds played on this source will be played at this volume.
        Parameters:
        newVolume - The new volume.

      • setPosition

        protected void setPosition(Vector3f position)
        Parameters:
        position - The 3D position of the source in the world.

      • loop

        protected void loop(boolean loop)
        Parameters:
        loop - Whether the source should play sounds on loop or not.

      • playSound

        protected AudioController playSound(Sound sound)
        Plays a sound and returns an AudioController which allows the settings of the source to be changed while the sound is playing. Streaming is automatically handled if the sound file is large.
        Parameters:
        sound - The sound to be played.
        Returns:
        The controller for the playing of this sound.

      • stop

        protected void stop()
        Stops the source playing the current sound.

      • setInactive

        protected void setInactive()
        Indicates that the source has finished playing the current sound. This notifies the current controller as well as removing any buffers that were queued to this source.

      • unqueue

        protected void unqueue()
        Removes the top buffer that has already been played from the queue (for use when streaming).

      • getFinishedBuffersCount

        protected int getFinishedBuffersCount()
        Returns:
        The number of buffers in the queue that have already been played (for use when streaming).

      • isPlaying

        protected boolean isPlaying()
        Returns:
        true if the source is currently playing a sound.

      • queue

        protected void queue(int buffer)
        Queues up a buffer to be played by this source as soon as it has finished playing the current buffer (for use when streaming).
        Parameters:
        buffer - The buffer to be queued.

      • pause

        protected void pause()
        Pauses the sound source.

      • unpause

        protected void unpause()
        Unpauses the currently paused sound source.

      • delete

        protected void delete()
        Deletes the source.
